==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=𡖈}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – two pieces of meat ({{zh-l|*⺼}}); the {{lang|zh|⺼}} components have been simplified to {{zh-l|*夕}}.

The conventional explanation is that this represented the concept of “many” through visual repetition. However, the earliest oracle bones use {{lang|zh|多}} for both “many” and another word meaning “to separate”, thus suggesting that {{lang|zh|多}} depicts a piece of meat cut in two. The word “to separate” was later written as {{och-l|誃}}.

===Etymology===
Related to {{cog|tai-pro|*ʰlaːjᴬ||many, much}}, whence {{cog|th|หลาย||many}}.

===Definitions===
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[many]]; [[much]]; [[a lot of]]; [[numerous]]
#: {{zh-ant|少}}
#* {{zh-x|街上 有 很 多 人。|There is '''a lot of''' people in the street}}
# {{lb|zh|after an amount}} [[over]]; and more; more than
#* {{zh-x|兩 年 多|'''more than''' two years}}
# {{lb|zh|used in comparison structure {{zh-l|*得多}}, {{zh-l|*多了}}}} much more; a lot more; far more
#* {{zh-x|他 比 我 高 得{de} 多。|He is a lot taller than I am.}}
#* {{zh-x|病人 今天 好 多 了。|The patient is much better today.}}
# [[more]]
#* {{zh-x|我 應該 多 運動。|I should exercise '''more'''.}}
#* {{zh-x|冚 多 張 被{pei5}|put on one '''more''' blanket|C}}
#* {{zh-x|今天 比 昨天 冷，得{děi} 多 穿 一 件 外套。|Today is colder than yesterday, so you have to put on one '''more''' jacket.}}
# [[extra]]; in [[excess]]
#* {{zh-x|佢 真係 好 易 醉，飲 多 兩 杯 啤酒 就 冧{lam3} 咗 喇。|He gets drunk really easily. He passed out after drinking a few '''extra''' glasses of beer.|C}}
# {{lb|zh|used in question}} [[how]]; [[how much]]; [[what]]
#* {{zh-x|你 到 學校 要 走 多 遠 的 距離？|What distance do you have to walk to school ?}}
#* {{zh-x|你 多 高？|How tall are you?}}
# {{lb|zh|emphasis in exclamations}} [[so]], [[how]], [[what]]
#* {{zh-x|看 她 多 漂亮 啊！|Look how pretty she is!}}
#* {{zh-x|她 戴 的 帽子 多 可愛 呀！|What an adorable hat she is wearing! / The hat she is wearing is so adorable!}}
# to [[have]] [[a lot]]
# to [[have]] more; to [[have]] too much; to [[have]] too many
#* {{zh-x|他 買 了 四 張 票，多 了 一 張。|He bought four tickets, which was one too many.}}

====Usage notes====
* {{sense|over, more than}} When the number is smaller or equal to 10, {{lang|zh|多}} can be put after the measure word. If it is bigger than ten, {{lang|zh|多}} has to be put before the measure word.
* {{sense|more}} Placing {{lang|zh|多}} after the verb is correct but it is less natural than placing it before.
